message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

The paper focuses on characterizing the information theoretically optimal communication overhead for distributed data shuffling, which involves communication and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with distributed computing and parallel processing, which falls under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper proposes a novel coded data delivery scheme, which involves machine learning and optimization, and can be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper deals with the worst-case communication overhead, which can be considered a system-level problem and falls under cs.SY (Systems and Control).
